title: Pilot
desc: Detective Jake Peralta finds his work scrutinized when new Captain, Ray Holt, takes over at his precinct.

title: The Tagger
desc: When Jake arrives late for work, Captain Holt decides to shadow him. However, the arrest they make proves complicated. Meanwhile, a psychic friend of Gina's gets inside Charles' head.

title: The Slump
desc: With a backlog of unsolved cases, Jake finds himself in a slump. Meanwhile, Amy is put in charge of the Junior Police Program for at risk kids, but her efforts to inspire them fall flat.

title: M.E. Time
desc: Jake meets an attractive Medical Examiner, but their relationship slows down her work, much to his colleagues' annoyance. Meanwhile, Amy desperately tries to impress Holt.

title: The Vulture
desc: A detective from Major Crimes takes over Jake's nearly solved murder case and steals his thunder.

title: Halloween
desc: Jake makes a foolish bet with Holt that he can steal his Medal of Valor before Halloween is over, while Amy is forced to wear a costume while undercover with Charles.

title: 48 Hours
desc: Jake stupidly arrests a male suspect despite having no evidence and only has 48 hours to prove he did it or release him without charge.

title: Old School
desc: Jake is horrified when his hero, Jimmy Brogan, a crime writer, accompanies him on the job, and threatens to quote him in a damning article. Meanwhile, Rosa has to work on her attitude in court.

title: Sal's Pizza
desc: Jake's favorite pizza place burns down and he is determined to prove the owner was not responsible. Meanwhile, Amy is jealous of Rosa's being offered a promotion, and Terry and Gina have to hire a new IT specialist.

title: Thanksgiving
desc: Amy hosts a Thanksgiving dinner at her apartment for everyone at the precinct, but it soon turns into a disaster.

title: Christmas
desc: When Holt receives death threats, he surprisingly puts Jake in charge of his security. Meanwhile, Terry undergoes a psych evaluation, and Amy tries to make the perfect holiday card for Holt.

title: Pontiac Bandit
desc: Jake convinces Rosa to make a deal with a criminal in order to catch a car thief, while Charles makes an awkward return to the precinct, and Holt tries to get rid of two puppies.

title: The Bet
desc: While Holt holds a celebration for Charles after he is awarded the Medal of Valor, Amy is forced to go on a ridiculous date with Jake after she loses their long-running bet.

title: The Ebony Falcon
desc: Jake begins to have second thoughts about putting Terry back in the field for a dangerous undercover assignment, while Rosa and Amy try to help Gina after she is robbed.

title: Operation: Broken Feather
desc: Jake is hurt when Amy tells him that she is considering leaving the precinct, while Terry helps Holt redesign the precinct to make everyone more productive.

title: The Party
desc: The officers in the precinct head over to Holt's house to celebrate his birthday, but they wind up making a poor impression on his husband.

title: Full Boyle
desc: Jake tries to keep Charles from going "full Boyle" on his new girlfriend. Meanwhile, Rosa and Amy are reluctant to help an amateur caped crime fighter, and Holt faces competition for the presidency of a police organization he founded.

title: The Apartment
desc: Due to his crippling debt, Jake faces losing his apartment, and asks Gina for help. Rosa and Charles clash with one of the weekend officers, and Holt and Terry ask their officers to conduct self-evaluations.

title: Tactical Village
desc: Jake tries to set a new record on a training course, Rosa is angry when she does not get an invite to Charles' wedding, and Gina helps Holt overcome his newfound addiction to a game on his smartphone.

title: Fancy Brudgom
desc: Jake tries to convince Charles to stand up to Vivian before the wedding, Terry struggles to stick to a diet after Amy and Gina give up, and Holt tries to get Rosa to make a sincere apology to an officer she offended.

title: Unsolvable
desc: Jake and Terry try to solve an apparently unsolvable case, Amy lies to Holt in order to dodge work and escape for a romantic weekend away, while Gina and Rosa introduce Charles to "Babylon", their secret bathroom.

title: Charges and Specs
desc: Jake's latest investigation results in administrative leave, and, ultimately, his firing from the NYPD. Meanwhile, Charles goes into a funk after Vivian breaks up with him before their wedding, and the others try to cheer him up.

title: Undercover
desc: Jake's undercover operation ends in a successful sting, until he learns one mobster has gotten away. Jake enlists Charles' help to track him down, and Holt tests the squad with practice drills. But can Charles keep his new secret from Jake?

title: Chocolate Milk
desc: Holt's old nemesis is in charge of the precinct inspection, Peralta and Jeffords investigate a stabbing before Jeffords goes in for his vasectomy, and Boyle needs a plus-one for his ex-wife's wedding.

title: The Jimmy Jab Games
desc: The precinct holds a competition while on stand-by for a motorcade, Holt has another run-in with Deputy Chief Wuntch, Boyle needs to get an incriminating videotape from Hitchcock, and Rosa thinks Peralta still has feelings for Santiago.

title: Halloween II
desc: The Peralta/Holt annual Halloween bet continues when Jake challenges the Captain that he can steal his watch before midnight. Meanwhile, Gina is upset that her dance team, Floorgasm, kicks her off the squad and Terry confronts her about her bad attitude.

title: The Mole
desc: There's a mole in the precinct and Holt and Jake need to find out who it is before Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch gets wind of it. Meanwhile, Terry and Rosa visit a "silent" disco to uncover new leads for their new drug task force.

title: Jake and Sophia
desc: Jake hits it off with a woman at a bar, but later finds out she is the attorney for a perp he is trying to put in jail. Meanwhile, Gina and Charles work to put their relationship behind them, and Amy is pressured into running for union rep.

title: Lockdown
desc: The precinct goes into lockdown mode on Thanksgiving night, and Jake, who was left in charge, is confident in his ability to keep spirits high and avoid chaos. Amy is less confident, as things spiral out of control.

title: USPIS
desc: While attempting to catch a drug dealer, Jake and Charles reluctantly join forces with the nerdy lead investigator at the U.S. Postal Service, Jack Danger. Meanwhile, the rest of the team helps Amy quit smoking.

title: The Road Trip
desc: Jake and Amy have a case early in the morning, so they stay at a hotel overnight. Jake invites Sophia and Amy's boyfriend not knowing that Amy is planning on breaking up with him.

title: The Pontiac Bandit Returns
desc: The Pontiac Bandit aka Doug Judy, is back in custody, after jamming up Jake and Rosa in his previous encounter with them. But when Rosa discovers that Judy knows the whereabouts of the "Giggle Pig" drug leader, Capt. Holt offers the perp a plea deal to help track down the drug kingpin. Meanwhile, Gina and Boyle are nervous that their parents might be getting too close, and Santiago makes Holt a Christmas gift against his wishes.

title: Stakeout
desc: Jake and Boyle go on a stakeout and tensions rise between the two, Rosa shows interest in Holt's nephew, and Terry writes a book for his daughters. Santiago and Gina are displeased when they assume the characters in the book are based on them.

title: Beach House
desc: The precinct's annual getaway to Boyle's beach house is ruined when Holt guilts Peralta into inviting him along for the festivities.

title: Payback
desc: Jake goes to great lengths to keep Terry's secret from the rest of the precinct, and Amy gets her chance to partner up with Captain Holt.

title: Defense Rests
desc: Jake tries to impress Sophia's boss. Gina refuses to give her blessing to her mom's engagement. Holt faces a difficult decision.

title: Windbreaker City
desc: Jake is heartbroken over Sophia, but his spirits are lifted when the squad is invited to a Homeland Security terrorist training simulation.

title: The Wednesday Incident
desc: Peralta sets out to prove that--for once--he is not the source of Captain Holt's bad mood. Boyle apprehends a notorious bank robber, who turns out to be a harmless-looking old man whom nobody else believes committed the crime.

title: Boyle-Linetti Wedding
desc: It's the day of Gina and Charles' parents' wedding, and the whole squad is given a job to fulfill for the ceremony. However, Jake and Amy get sidetracked chasing a criminal, and Terry struggles to officiate the wedding.

title: Captain Peralta
desc: Jake's mainly absentee father, Roger (guest star Bradley Whitford), comes to town to spend some time with his son. Jake can't wait to see him, but Charles is skeptical of Roger's intentions. Meanwhile, Holt tasks Amy, Terry, Gina and Rosa with an impossible brain teaser in exchange for Beyonc√© tickets.

title: Sabotage
desc: Amy and Rosa investigate Jake's claim that somebody is trying to sabotage him and get him fired. Boyle partners up with Hitchcock and Scully to solve a case. Captain Holt refuses to lie with Terry about attending Gina's dance performance.

title: AC/DC
desc: Jake is badly injured trying to chase a suspect, but he refuses to take time off from the job. Holt and Rosa have an awkward dinner date with their significant others, so they invite Amy and Gina along as well.

title: Det. Dave Majors
desc: Jake is jealous when a detective from another precinct wants to ask Amy out on a date. Linetti and Boyle try to keep Jeffords from taking a job with a private firm, but captain Holt seems to be pushing him out the door.

title: The Chopper
desc: When Wuntch lets Jake work his dream case, Holt worries she is setting them up to fail. Meanwhile, Terry hopes to get his girls off the wait list for a magnet school by hosting a field trip.

title: Johnny and Dora
desc: When Jake and Amy go under cover to catch an identity thief, the investigation brings them closer.

title: New Captain
desc: Nobody in the precinct likes the new captain, Wuntch continues to humiliate Holt as he takes his new job in Public Relations, and Jake and Amy try to figure out what to do next after their kiss.

title: The Funeral
desc: The Nine-Nine gets another personnel change that could put Jake and Amy's budding relationship at risk. Meanwhile, Terry assists Holt with an important public relations matter, and Rosa and Gina try to convince Charles to rethink his affection for a fellow officer.

title: Boyle's Hunch
desc: Jake thinks Boyle might have met his soul-mate in Genevieve, an art gallery owner, and he tries to help set them up. Meanwhile, Rosa deals with intra-precinct theft and Holt seeks Amy's help with an image campaign.

title: The Oolong Slayer
desc: Jake and Holt both get in trouble when they work on a serial killer case together in secret. The Vulture asks Amy and Rosa set up his birthday party. Boyle introduces Terry to a delicious new snack.

title: Halloween III
desc: For this year's Halloween challenge, Jake and Holt divide the precinct into teams as they try to see who can steal a crown held under lock and key in the interrogation room.

title: Into the Woods
desc: Jake and Charles talk Terry into going camping; Rosa receives relationship advice from Holt; Gina helps Amy prepare for a presentation.

title: The Mattress
desc: Jake and Amy work together on a case, and wind up arguing over Jake's old, worn-out mattress. Meanwhile, Boyle scratches Holt's prized car, and the teenage boy Rosa sponsors as a "big brother" is in trouble with the law.

title: Ava
desc: Jake entertains Terry's pregnant wife, Sharon, until her water breaks sooner than expected and crisis ensues at the precinct.

title: The Swedes
desc: Jake and Rosa investigate a case in which they have to assist InterPol. Amy and Terry team up to help Gina study for an exam, while Captain Holt recruits Charles to double with him in a squash tournament.

title: Yippie Kayak
desc: Jake, Charles and Gina get into trouble while doing last-minute Christmas shopping, Terry tries to make it through the holidays without a call from the precinct, and Amy takes part in a "Polar Swim" with Holt and Diaz.

title: Hostage Situation
desc: Jake helps Charles reclaim the rights to his sperm from his ex-wife, Amy accidentally breaks Terry's nose after asking for a recommendation, and Gina helps interrogate a suspect who refuses to speak to anyone but her.

title: 9 Days
desc: Peralta and Holt contract the Mumps while working on a cold case. Terry takes over the precinct in his place, but his ambitious plans ultimately fail. Boyle is sad over the death of his dog, but Diaz doesn't understand it.

title: The Cruise
desc: Jake comes face-to-face with his old nemesis Doug Judy as he and Amy go on a cruise. Meanwhile, Holt's sister comes to town for a visit, and Diaz and Boyle fight over a rent-controlled apartment which was a crime scene.

title: Karen Peralta
desc: On Jake's birthday, his Mom tells him she is back together with his hated father. Meanwhile, Charles has an embarrassing moment with a body cam, and Holt's "Escape the Room" exercise for the Nine-Nine does not go as planned.

title: The 9-8
desc: Chaos ensues when the Nine-Nine is forced to share their station with the Nine-Eight precinct while their station is closed, and Charles consequently becomes jealous of Jake's old partner, who is an officer in the Nine-Eight.

title: House Mouses
desc: Trying to get called to a "celebrity" case, Jake tricks Hitchcock and Scully into taking a case that might me more dangerous than everyone thought. Amy, Rosa, and Gina take the day to conquer their worst fears

title: Adrian Pimento
desc: The precinct gains a new detective who has just completed a 12-year undercover job with the mob, Charles' latest mess prompts the janitors to refuse to clean the precinct, and Gina directs a video for Holt.

title: Cheddar
desc: While Holt is en route to visit Kevin in Paris, Jake and Amy inadvertently lose his dog. Meanwhile, Charles has laser eye surgery, and the sexual tension between Rosa and Adrian Pimento disgusts Terry.

title: Terry Kitties
desc: Terry enlists Jake's help in solving a twenty year old case which his old precinct never let him forget, Charles allows Adrian Pimento to stay at his place and soon regrets it, while Amy, Rosa and Holt attend a class together.

title: Paranoia
desc: The precinct tries to set up perfect bachelor and bachelorette parties for Adrian and Rosa after they announce their engagement, but Adrian's party falls apart when he tells everyone that someone is stalking him and steals the party bus.

title: Maximum Security
desc: With Adrian off the grid and in hiding, the rest of the squad scramble to track down the sister of Figgis, the mobster behind the operation, and throw a fake funeral to flush out Figgis' hit man.

title: Bureau
desc: While Amy continues to work on Figgis' sister Maura on the inside, Jake, Rosa and Holt team up with Bob Annderson to track down the FBI mole. Meanwhile, Gina helps Terry work out the culprit behind a press leak.

title: Greg and Larry
desc: After a surprising turn of events in the Nine-Nine's attempt to track down Adrian Pimento's hitman, the precinct drops everything when they suspect Holt is in danger.

title: Coral Palms, Part 1
desc: Jake and Holt adjust to their new lives in Florida under the Witness Protection Program while Jimmy "The Butcher" Figgis remains on the loose.

title: Coral Palms, Part 2
desc: Jake and Holt plan their attack on Jimmy "The Butcher" Figgis, only to end up on the other side of the interrogation table.

title: Coral Palms, Part 3
desc: The team goes to Florida to help Jake and Holt take down Jimmy Figgis, but their plan falls through due to an unexpected injury and another interruption from Sheriff Reynolds.

title: The Night Shift
desc: Jake, on his first case back at the precinct, commandeers the vehicle of Jess Day, (from New Girl) who's visiting New York. In the meantime, Holt tries to increase office morale and Amy wants to know why Rosa is taking such long breaks.

title: Halloween IV
desc: The squad competes in the annual Halloween heist to win the title of Ultimate Detective Slash Genius.

title: Monster in the Closet
desc: The Nine-Nine throws a wedding for Pimento and Rosa.

title: Mr. Santiago
desc: Amy's father, a former cop, comes to Thanksgiving dinner and Jake tries to impress him, leaving Charles on turkey duty. In the meantime, Holt helps Pimento come to terms with the fact that he can no longer be a police officer.

title: Skyfire Cycle
desc: Terry meets his lifelong hero, a famous author who's received death threats. In other events, Gina tries to choose the location of the Boyle family vacation and Amy sides with Kevin in his argument with Holt over a math puzzle.

title: The Overmining
desc: Jake and Holt help Captain CJ with a big case.

title: Captain Latvia
desc: Jake and Charles face off against a Latvian criminal ring when Jake helps Charles find his son's favorite toy for Christmas.

title: The Fugitive, Part 1
desc: The squad goes on a manhunt for a group of convicts who've escaped from a prison van on the streets of Brooklyn. When one fugitive is still loose, Jake gains a surprising ally.

title: The Fugitive, Part 2
desc: The squad goes on a manhunt for a group of convicts who've escaped from a prison van on the streets of Brooklyn. When one fugitive is still loose, Jake gains a surprising ally.

title: The Audit
desc: The squad tries to save their precinct from getting shut down when it's being audited by Amy's ex-boyfriend Teddy.

title: Serve & Protect
desc: Jake and Rosa investigate a case of burglary that occurred on the set of one of their favorite detective shows as Terry's ex takes over auditing the Nine-Nine.

title: The Last Ride
desc: Jake and Charles search for a bike thief on what may be their last case together.

title: Moo Moo
desc: Terry and Holt have different ideas for dealing with a fellow police officer who creates trouble for Terry in his own neighborhood.

title: Cop-Con
desc: Holt tells the squad to be on their best behavior at Cop-Con.

title: Chasing Amy
desc: Amy disappears just before the Sergeant exam.

title: Your Honor
desc: Captain Holt's mother comes to the precinct for help when her house is robbed.

title: The Slaughterhouse
desc: Jake and Rosa attempt to earn their idol's respect.

title: The Bank Job
desc: Jake and Rosa learn there's more to Lieutenant Hawkins' team than meets the eye as they continue searching for bank robbers.

title: Crime & Punishment
desc: Jake and Rosa are framed for a crime they didn't commit.

title: The Big House Pt. 1
desc: Jake and Rosa each adjust differently to life in prison.

title: The Big House Pt. 2
desc: Jake is torn between the warden and Romero, while a local mobster claims he can prove that Hawkins is guilty.

title: Kicks
desc: Jake must pass an official evaluation performed by Holt in order to solve a real case.

title: HalloVeen
desc: The Nine-Nine has their fifth annual Halloween heist, and everyone has until midnight to claim the title of "Amazing Human/Genius".

title: Bad Beat
desc: Jake, Terry and Holt go undercover at an illegal gambling club to track down an arms dealer.

title: The Venue
desc: The Vulture returns and threatens to take away something important from Jake and Amy.

title: Two Turkeys
desc: Jake and Amy bring their parents together for Thanksgiving.

title: Return to Skyfire
desc: When DC Parlov returns to the precinct to report his latest manuscript being stolen, Terry, Jake and Rosa go undercover at a fantasy convention to catch the culprit.

Holt learns he's in the running to become Chief Commissioner of the NYPD when the squad is in LA for a funeral, but when they miss their flight back to New York, Jake tries to get Holt back in time for the interview.

title: Game Night
desc: Jake helps Rosa break big news to her parents.

title: The Favor
desc: Holt owes Seamus Murphy a favor, so the precinct searches for a loophole that will allow the captain to keep his end of the bargain without breaking the law.

title: Safe House
desc: After Seamus threatens Kevin, Holt devises an elaborate plan to hide him in a safe house, with Jake as his guard. Kevin is miserable as the 99 works overtime to find Seamus and take him down.

title: The Negotiation
desc: Jake runs into a familiar face when he's called in to negotiate a hostage situation with a jewel thief.

title: The Box
desc: Jake and Holt spend all night trying to get a confession out of a suspect.

title: The Puzzle Master
desc: Jake and Amy investigate a series of arsons connected to Amy's favorite crossword puzzle author.

title: NutriBoom
desc: Jake and Charles get suckered into a pyramid scheme.

title: DFW
desc: Jake meets his half-sister and she invites herself to stay.

title: Gray Star Mutual
desc: Pimento shows up as the insurance agent when a fire destroys Charles' food truck.

title: Bachelor/ette Party
desc: Charles plans a scavenger hunt for Jake's bachelor party; Amy's bachelorette party escalates when it's discovered she once slept with a member of her soon-to-be wedding band.

title: Show Me Going
desc: The Nine-Nine fears for Rosa's safety when she responds to an active shooter alert.

title: White Whale
desc: Rosa and Amy track down a killer who's managed to elude them for seven years; Terry helps Jake with his wedding chores; Holt and his rival try to convince each other to resign from the campaign for Commissioner.

title: Jake & Amy
desc: The squad rushes to save Jake and Amy's wedding day from a major threat.

title: Honeymoon
desc: Jake and Amy go on their honeymoon; Gina and Charles get into a family squabble; Terry tries to live up to his new nickname.

title: Hitchcock & Scully
desc: Jake and Charles investigate a case of Hitchcock and Scully's from the 1980s; meanwhile, Amy's uniformed officers and Terry's detectives fight over limited resources.

title: The Tattler
desc: Jake and Gina attend their 20th high school reunion. Back at the Nine-Nine, Charles helps Rosa with her love life.

title: Four Movements
desc: Gina plays a high-stakes game of chess with Capt. Holt; Rosa and Amy take Gina out for a fancy brunch; Jake and Gina must use their wits to infiltrate a posh club.

title: A Tale of Two Bandits
desc: Terry believes the Pontiac Bandit has gone back to stealing cars, but Jake tries to prove him wrong; the rest of the squad fight to keep Shaw's a police bar when some firemen stake a claim to it.

title: The Crime Scene
desc: Jake and Rosa must deal with a mother in mourning when they work on a difficult murder case with confusing evidence.

title: The Honeypot
desc: Jake and Holt clash over the merits of a new hire in the 99th precinct. Terry, Amy, Rosa and Charles try to do something about the cluttered bullpen.

title: He Said, She Said
desc: Jake and Amy investigate a difficult "he said, she said" case of sexual assault. Holt becomes suspicious after learning his lifelong arch nemesis died in a prison transport accident.

title: The Golden Child
desc: Jake helps Amy navigate the complicated relationship she has with her brother, David. Charles introduces some drama into an undercover mission involving Terry and Holt.

title: Gintars
desc: A visitor from Latvia causes Charles and Jake to investigate Nikolaj's family. Holt and Amy bring in famed forensic scientist Dr. Yee to help close a case for Rosa.

title: The Therapist
desc: Charles gets Jake involved in a case where a therapist reports one of his patients missing; Holt learns that Rosa has a new girlfriend whom everyone else has met; Amy thinks she mistakenly received a package for Terry.

title: Casecation
desc: Work is so busy for Jake and Amy that they end up celebrating their anniversary while standing guard over a comatose patient in the hospital.

title: The Bimbo
desc: Holt and Jake investigate a case at Kevin's university. Back at the precinct, Terry and Amy take the squad out for lunch.

title: Ticking Clocks
desc: Jake and the squad must track down a hacker who has infiltrated the Nine-Nine's servers; Rosa deals with relationship issues; Hitchcock and Scully attempt to cook the perfect lasagna.

title: Return of the King
desc: When Gina returns to the Nine-Nine, Jake and Terry get drawn into her life. Holt learns that Charles' son, Nikolaj, may be a genius; Rosa copes with an injury.

title: Cinco de Mayo
desc: In order to distract Terry from the stress of his upcoming lieutenant's exam, Jake, Holt and the squad decide to hold the annual Halloween Heist on a new date, Cinco de Mayo.

title: Sicko
desc: Jake and Charles investigate a dangerous serial killer. Holt continues to spar with his rival, Commissioner Kelly. Terry tries to find a way to stay at the Nine-Nine.

title: Suicide Squad
desc: Desperate circumstances call for desperate measures, as Jake, Holt, Amy, Terry, Rosa and Charles must ally themselves with old enemies.

title: Manhunter
desc: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt on a city councilor; Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer.

title: Captain Kim
desc: The new captain of the Nine-Nine invites the squad over to her house for a dinner party.

title: Pimemento
desc: Adrian Pimento shows up unexpectedly to seek Jake and Charles' help after claiming someone is trying to kill him; the rest of the squad endures a workplace conflict seminar.

title: The Jimmy Jab Games II
desc: Competitive juices are flowing as Jake and the squad compete in the second Jimmy Jab Games.

title: Debbie
desc: When cocaine and weapons are stolen from the evidence lock-up, the squad must investigate the Nine-Nine itself.

title: Trying
desc: Jake and Amy work an uncrackable case while Holt adjusts to a new beat. Hitchcock looks for the love of his life.

title: Ding Dong
desc: Capt. Holt deals with a personal loss; Jake must decide whether to take Terry or Charles to an exclusive event.

title: The Takeback
desc: Doug Judy is back, and this time, things between him and Jake are personal; Amy and Charles try to find the perfect new vending machine for the Nine-Nine.

title: Dillman
desc: When a prank goes disastrously awry, things at the Nine-Nine take a distinctly Agatha Christie turn.

title: Admiral Peralta
desc: Jake and his father deal with unsettled family business; Amy and Rosa work a high-profile case; Terry wants to join the NYPD band.

title: Valloweaster
desc: The squad competes in an effort to determine who is the greatest human/genius.

title: Ransom
desc: Holt asks for Jake's help in a case that is exceptionally meaningful to him. Charles and Terry work together on a side business.

title: Lights Out
desc: The entire squad is on high alert when a massive blackout hits Brooklyn.

title: The Good Ones
desc: Amy returns from maternity leave; Jake and Rosa work a difficult case.

title: The Lake House
desc: The squad takes Capt. Holt up on an offer for a weekend getaway.

title: Blue Flu
desc: Captain Holt and Amy manage an understaffed precinct; Jake and Charles investigate.

title: Balancing
desc: Jake and Amy create a system to balance work and childcare; Rosa gets a new houseguest.

title: PB&J
desc: Jake takes an old friend for a ride.

title: The Set Up
desc: When the FBI takes over a high-profile case, Jake keeps digging; Amy and Rosa negotiate with O'Sullivan and the police union.

title: Game of Boyles
desc: Terry, Jake and Charles visit the Boyle Family Farm; Amy and Rosa help out Capt. Holt.

title: Renewal
desc: The squad comes together to work an important high-stakes case.

title: The Last Day Pt 1
desc: The squad takes stock of their eight years together and look towards their future.

title: The Last Day Pt 2
desc: The squad takes stock of their eight years together and look towards their future.
